intro: Pimelea rigida, commonly known as the rigid bottlebrush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its distinctive cylindrical flower spikes that resemble bottle brushes. The plant typically grows in heathlands and sandy soils, preferring full sun exposure. Its leaves are narrow and linear, often covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are predominantly white or cream in color. Pimelea rigida is well adapted to dry conditions and is often used in native gardens for its ornamental value.
